content:
I notice from previous questions that you have experienced issues with Message Filters window as well as this Search Messages window.

Please check the following:

  • In Thunderbird - Settings > General
  • Scroll to bottom and click on 'Config Editor'
  • In search type: pixel
  • Look for: layout.css.devPixelsPerPx

It should have a negative number: -1.0 If it has anything else then click on the 'Reset' curved arrow on the right OR click on the pencil icon , remove all content and then type the negative number exactly like this: -1.0 and click on the tick icon to save.

Then Test both the 'Message Filters' and click on 'New' and also the 'Find' > 'Search Messages'

Please report on what you discovered was set up for that 'layout.css.devPixelsPerPx' setting and whether resetting to default solved the issue.
creator: Toad-Hall

content: Note: Menu app icon (3 lines) > Font Size You can control the UI font size via this method - click on the + icon to increase the font size. Repeat until you have a more suitable size.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

content: If the previous PC is still available, we can assist in the recovery. Let us know.

content:
re :I left account A (Google)

What do you mean by this? Did you close the account A in google ? If you logon to google A webmail account via a browser what do you see?

Is account A set up as an Imap account ?

If index is out of synch with download in mbox file then you could try to repair the index.

  • Right click on folder and select 'Properties'
  • Click on 'Repair folder'
  • click on 'OK'
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Hi Chris!

1. When composing an e-mail, you can tap the three dot menu, and the first option is the one you want. It works by Android's share mechanism. 2. If you enter a comma or a semicolon after the email address, you can add another one after, this works in all the fields (To, CC, BCC).

Regards, Bal√°zs

content:
POP only downloads the Inbox. Add the account as IMAP to see (subscribe) all folders. Copy messages from IMAP folders to Local Folders for offline access.

http://kb.mozillazine.org/Convert_a_POP_account_to_a_IMAP_account
creator: sfhowes
